CreateCapability.name: CreateCapability
CreateCapability.documentation: Instantiates a capability based on the specified parameters. A trading capability contains the information required to transform incoming EDI documents into JSON or XML outputs.

CreatePartnership.name: CreatePartnership
CreatePartnership.documentation: Creates a partnership between a customer and a trading partner, based on the supplied parameters. A partnership represents the connection between you and your trading partner. It ties together a profile and one or more trading capabilities.

CreateProfile.name: CreateProfile
CreateProfile.documentation: Creates a customer profile. You can have up to five customer profiles, each representing a distinct private network. A profile is the mechanism used to create the concept of a private network.

CreateStarterMappingTemplate.name: CreateStarterMappingTemplate
CreateStarterMappingTemplate.documentation:
Amazon Web Services B2B Data Interchange uses a mapping template in JSONata or XSLT format to transform a customer input file into a JSON or XML file that can be converted to EDI.

If you provide a sample EDI file with the same structure as the EDI files that you wish to generate, then the service can generate a mapping template. The starter template contains placeholder values which you can replace with JSONata or XSLT expressions to take data from your input file and insert it into the JSON or XML file that is used to generate the EDI.

If you do not provide a sample EDI file, then the service can generate a mapping template based on the EDI settings in the templateDetails parameter.

Currently, we only support generating a template that can generate the input to produce an Outbound X12 EDI file.

CreateTransformer.name: CreateTransformer
CreateTransformer.documentation:
Creates a transformer. Amazon Web Services B2B Data Interchange currently supports two scenarios:

  • Inbound EDI: the Amazon Web Services customer receives an EDI file from their trading partner. Amazon Web Services B2B Data Interchange converts this EDI file into a JSON or XML file with a service-defined structure. A mapping template provided by the customer, in JSONata or XSLT format, is optionally applied to this file to produce a JSON or XML file with the structure the customer requires.

  • Outbound EDI: the Amazon Web Services customer has a JSON or XML file containing data that they wish to use in an EDI file. A mapping template, provided by the customer (in either JSONata or XSLT format) is applied to this file to generate a JSON or XML file in the service-defined structure. This file is then converted to an EDI file.

The following fields are provided for backwards compatibility only: fileFormat, mappingTemplate, ediType, and sampleDocument.

  • Use the mapping data type in place of mappingTemplate and fileFormat

  • Use the sampleDocuments data type in place of sampleDocument

  • Use either the inputConversion or outputConversion in place of ediType

DeleteCapability.name: DeleteCapability
DeleteCapability.documentation: Deletes the specified capability. A trading capability contains the information required to transform incoming EDI documents into JSON or XML outputs.

DeletePartnership.name: DeletePartnership
DeletePartnership.documentation: Deletes the specified partnership. A partnership represents the connection between you and your trading partner. It ties together a profile and one or more trading capabilities.

DeleteProfile.name: DeleteProfile
DeleteProfile.documentation: Deletes the specified profile. A profile is the mechanism used to create the concept of a private network.

DeleteTransformer.name: DeleteTransformer
DeleteTransformer.documentation: Deletes the specified transformer. A transformer can take an EDI file as input and transform it into a JSON-or XML-formatted document. Alternatively, a transformer can take a JSON-or XML-formatted document as input and transform it into an EDI file.

GetCapability.name: GetCapability
GetCapability.documentation: Retrieves the details for the specified capability. A trading capability contains the information required to transform incoming EDI documents into JSON or XML outputs.

GetPartnership.name: GetPartnership
GetPartnership.documentation: Retrieves the details for a partnership, based on the partner and profile IDs specified. A partnership represents the connection between you and your trading partner. It ties together a profile and one or more trading capabilities.

GetProfile.name: GetProfile
GetProfile.documentation: Retrieves the details for the profile specified by the profile ID. A profile is the mechanism used to create the concept of a private network.

GetTransformer.name: GetTransformer
GetTransformer.documentation: Retrieves the details for the transformer specified by the transformer ID. A transformer can take an EDI file as input and transform it into a JSON-or XML-formatted document. Alternatively, a transformer can take a JSON-or XML-formatted document as input and transform it into an EDI file.

GetTransformerJob.name: GetTransformerJob
GetTransformerJob.documentation: Returns the details of the transformer run, based on the Transformer job ID.

ListCapabilities.name: ListCapabilities
ListCapabilities.documentation: Lists the capabilities associated with your Amazon Web Services account for your current or specified region. A trading capability contains the information required to transform incoming EDI documents into JSON or XML outputs.

ListPartnerships.name: ListPartnerships
ListPartnerships.documentation: Lists the partnerships associated with your Amazon Web Services account for your current or specified region. A partnership represents the connection between you and your trading partner. It ties together a profile and one or more trading capabilities.

ListProfiles.name: ListProfiles
ListProfiles.documentation: Lists the profiles associated with your Amazon Web Services account for your current or specified region. A profile is the mechanism used to create the concept of a private network.

ListTagsForResource.name: ListTagsForResource
ListTagsForResource.documentation: Lists all of the tags associated with the Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that you specify. The resource can be a capability, partnership, profile, or transformer.

ListTransformers.name: ListTransformers
ListTransformers.documentation: Lists the available transformers. A transformer can take an EDI file as input and transform it into a JSON-or XML-formatted document. Alternatively, a transformer can take a JSON-or XML-formatted document as input and transform it into an EDI file.

StartTransformerJob.name: StartTransformerJob
StartTransformerJob.documentation:
Runs a job, using a transformer, to parse input EDI (electronic data interchange) file into the output structures used by Amazon Web Services B2B Data Interchange.

If you only want to transform EDI (electronic data interchange) documents, you don't need to create profiles, partnerships or capabilities. Just create and configure a transformer, and then run the StartTransformerJob API to process your files.

TagResource.name: TagResource
TagResource.documentation:
Attaches a key-value pair to a resource, as identified by its Amazon Resource Name (ARN). Resources are capability, partnership, profile, transformers and other entities.

There is no response returned from this call.

TestConversion.name: TestConversion
TestConversion.documentation: This operation mimics the latter half of a typical Outbound EDI request. It takes an input JSON/XML in the B2Bi shape as input, converts it to an X12 EDI string, and return that string.

TestMapping.name: TestMapping
TestMapping.documentation: Maps the input file according to the provided template file. The API call downloads the file contents from the Amazon S3 location, and passes the contents in as a string, to the inputFileContent parameter.

TestParsing.name: TestParsing
TestParsing.documentation: Parses the input EDI (electronic data interchange) file. The input file has a file size limit of 250 KB.

UntagResource.name: UntagResource
UntagResource.documentation: Detaches a key-value pair from the specified resource, as identified by its Amazon Resource Name (ARN). Resources are capability, partnership, profile, transformers and other entities.

UpdateCapability.name: UpdateCapability
UpdateCapability.documentation: Updates some of the parameters for a capability, based on the specified parameters. A trading capability contains the information required to transform incoming EDI documents into JSON or XML outputs.

UpdatePartnership.name: UpdatePartnership
UpdatePartnership.documentation: Updates some of the parameters for a partnership between a customer and trading partner. A partnership represents the connection between you and your trading partner. It ties together a profile and one or more trading capabilities.

UpdateProfile.name: UpdateProfile
UpdateProfile.documentation: Updates the specified parameters for a profile. A profile is the mechanism used to create the concept of a private network.

UpdateTransformer.name: UpdateTransformer
UpdateTransformer.documentation: Updates the specified parameters for a transformer. A transformer can take an EDI file as input and transform it into a JSON-or XML-formatted document. Alternatively, a transformer can take a JSON-or XML-formatted document as input and transform it into an EDI file.

AccessDeniedException.documentation: You do not have sufficient access to perform this action.

CapabilityConfiguration.documentation: A capability object. Currently, only EDI (electronic data interchange) capabilities are supported. A trading capability contains the information required to transform incoming EDI documents into JSON or XML outputs.

outboundEdi.documentation: A structure that contains the outbound EDI options.

CapabilityOptions.documentation: Contains the details for an Outbound EDI capability.

capabilityId.documentation: Returns a system-assigned unique identifier for the capability.

name.documentation: The display name of the capability.

type.documentation: Returns the type of the capability. Currently, only edi is supported.

createdAt.documentation: Returns a timestamp for creation date and time of the capability.

modifiedAt.documentation: Returns a timestamp that identifies the most recent date and time that the capability was modified.

CapabilitySummary.documentation: Returns the capability summary details. A trading capability contains the information required to transform incoming EDI documents into JSON or XML outputs.

ConflictException.documentation: A conflict exception is thrown when you attempt to delete a resource (such as a profile or a capability) that is being used by other resources.

fileFormat.documentation: The format for the input file: either JSON or XML.

ConversionSource.documentation: Describes the input for an outbound transformation.

formatDetails.documentation: A structure that contains the formatting details for the conversion target.

outputSampleFile.documentation: Customer uses this to provide a sample on what should file look like after conversion X12 EDI use case around this would be discovering the file syntax

ConversionTarget.documentation: Provide a sample of what the output of the transformation should look like.

ConversionTargetFormatDetails.documentation: Contains a structure describing the X12 details for the conversion target.

name.documentation: Specifies the name of the capability, used to identify it.

type.documentation: Specifies the type of the capability. Currently, only edi is supported.

configuration.documentation: Specifies a structure that contains the details for a capability.

instructionsDocuments.documentation: Specifies one or more locations in Amazon S3, each specifying an EDI document that can be used with this capability. Each item contains the name of the bucket and the key, to identify the document's location.

tags.documentation: Specifies the key-value pairs assigned to ARNs that you can use to group and search for resources by type. You can attach this metadata to resources (capabilities, partnerships, and so on) for any purpose.

capabilityId.documentation: Returns a system-assigned unique identifier for the capability.

capabilityArn.documentation: Returns an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a specific Amazon Web Services resource, such as a capability, partnership, profile, or transformer.

name.documentation: Specifies the name of the profile.

email.documentation: Specifies the email address associated with this customer profile.

phone.documentation: Specifies the phone number associated with the profile.

logging.documentation: Specifies whether or not logging is enabled for this profile.

tags.documentation: Specifies the key-value pairs assigned to ARNs that you can use to group and search for resources by type. You can attach this metadata to resources (capabilities, partnerships, and so on) for any purpose.

outputSampleLocation.documentation: Specify the location of the sample EDI file that is used to generate the mapping template.

mappingType.documentation: Specify the format for the mapping template: either JSONATA or XSLT.

templateDetails.documentation: Describes the details needed for generating the template. Specify the X12 transaction set and version for which the template is used: currently, we only support X12.

mappingTemplate.documentation: Returns a string that represents the mapping template.

name.documentation: Specifies the name of the transformer, used to identify it.

tags.documentation: Specifies the key-value pairs assigned to ARNs that you can use to group and search for resources by type. You can attach this metadata to resources (capabilities, partnerships, and so on) for any purpose.

fileFormat.documentation: Specifies that the currently supported file formats for EDI transformations are JSON and XML.
fileFormat.deprecatedMessage: This is a legacy trait. Please use input-conversion or output-conversion.

mappingTemplate.documentation:
Specifies the mapping template for the transformer. This template is used to map the parsed EDI file using JSONata or XSLT.

This parameter is available for backwards compatibility. Use the Mapping data type instead.

ediType.documentation: Specifies the details for the EDI standard that is being used for the transformer. Currently, only X12 is supported. X12 is a set of standards and corresponding messages that define specific business documents.

sampleDocument.documentation: Specifies a sample EDI document that is used by a transformer as a guide for processing the EDI data.

outputLocation.documentation: Contains the Amazon S3 bucket and prefix for the location of the output file, which is contained in an S3Location object.

transformerId.documentation: Returns the system-assigned unique identifier for the transformer.

EdiConfiguration.documentation: Specifies the details for the EDI (electronic data interchange) transformation.

x12Details.documentation: Returns the details for the EDI standard that is being used for the transformer. Currently, only X12 is supported. X12 is a set of standards and corresponding messages that define specific business documents.

outputFiles.documentation: Returns the location for the output files. If the caller specified a directory for the output, then this contains the full path to the output file, including the file name generated by the service.

message.documentation: Returns an optional error message, which gets populated when the job is not run successfully.

transformerId.documentation: Specifies the system-assigned unique identifier for the transformer.

mapping.documentation: Returns the structure that contains the mapping template and its language (either XSLT or JSONATA).

outputConversion.documentation: Returns the OutputConversion object, which contains the format options for the outbound transformation.

sampleDocuments.documentation: Returns a structure that contains the Amazon S3 bucket and an array of the corresponding keys used to identify the location for your sample documents.

fromFormat.documentation: The format for the transformer input: currently on X12 is supported.

formatOptions.documentation: A structure that contains the formatting options for an inbound transformer.

InputConversion.documentation: Contains the input formatting options for an inbound transformer (takes an X12-formatted EDI document as input and converts it to JSON or XML.

fileContent.documentation: Specify the input contents, as a string, for the source of an outbound transformation.

InputFileSource.documentation: The input file to use for an outbound transformation.

retryAfterSeconds.documentation: The server attempts to retry a failed command.

InternalServerException.documentation: This exception is thrown when an error occurs in the Amazon Web Services B2B Data Interchange service.

nextToken.documentation: When additional results are obtained from the command, a NextToken parameter is returned in the output. You can then pass the NextToken parameter in a subsequent command to continue listing additional resources.

maxResults.documentation: Specifies the maximum number of capabilities to return.

capabilities.documentation: Returns one or more capabilities associated with this partnership.

nextToken.documentation: When additional results are obtained from the command, a NextToken parameter is returned in the output. You can then pass the NextToken parameter in a subsequent command to continue listing additional resources.

profileId.documentation: Specifies the unique, system-generated identifier for the profile connected to this partnership.

nextToken.documentation: When additional results are obtained from the command, a NextToken parameter is returned in the output. You can then pass the NextToken parameter in a subsequent command to continue listing additional resources.

maxResults.documentation: Specifies the maximum number of capabilities to return.

nextToken.documentation: When additional results are obtained from the command, a NextToken parameter is returned in the output. You can then pass the NextToken parameter in a subsequent command to continue listing additional resources.

When additional results are obtained from the command, a NextToken parameter is returned in the output. You can then pass the NextToken parameter in a subsequent command to continue listing additional resources.

maxResults.documentation: Specifies the maximum number of profiles to return.

nextToken.documentation: When additional results are obtained from the command, a NextToken parameter is returned in the output. You can then pass the NextToken parameter in a subsequent command to continue listing additional resources.

ResourceARN.documentation: Requests the tags associated with a particular Amazon Resource Name (ARN). An ARN is an identifier for a specific Amazon Web Services resource, such as a capability, partnership, profile, or transformer.

Tags.documentation: Returns the key-value pairs assigned to ARNs that you can use to group and search for resources by type. You can attach this metadata to resources (capabilities, partnerships, and so on) for any purpose.

nextToken.documentation: When additional results are obtained from the command, a NextToken parameter is returned in the output. You can then pass the NextToken parameter in a subsequent command to continue listing additional resources.

maxResults.documentation: Specifies the number of items to return for the API response.

transformers.documentation:
Returns an array of one or more transformer objects.

For each transformer, a TransformerSummary object is returned. The TransformerSummary contains all the details for a specific transformer.

nextToken.documentation: When additional results are obtained from the command, a NextToken parameter is returned in the output. You can then pass the NextToken parameter in a subsequent command to continue listing additional resources.

templateLanguage.documentation: The transformation language for the template, either XSLT or JSONATA.

template.documentation: A string that represents the mapping template, in the transformation language specified in templateLanguage.

Mapping.documentation: Specifies the mapping template for the transformer. This template is used to map the parsed EDI file using JSONata or XSLT.

x12.documentation: A structure that contains an X12 envelope structure.

toFormat.documentation: The format for the output from an outbound transformer: only X12 is currently supported.

formatOptions.documentation: A structure that contains the X12 transaction set and version for the transformer output.

OutputConversion.documentation: Contains the formatting options for an outbound transformer (takes JSON or XML as input and converts it to an EDI document (currently only X12 format is supported).

OutputSampleFileSource.documentation: Container for the location of a sample file used for outbound transformations.

profileId.documentation: Returns the unique, system-generated identifier for the profile connected to this partnership.

partnershipId.documentation: Returns the unique, system-generated identifier for a partnership.

name.documentation: Returns the name of the partnership.

capabilities.documentation: Returns one or more capabilities associated with this partnership.

tradingPartnerId.documentation: Returns the unique, system-generated identifier for a trading partner.

createdAt.documentation: Returns a timestamp for creation date and time of the partnership.

modifiedAt.documentation: Returns a timestamp that identifies the most recent date and time that the partnership was modified.

PartnershipSummary.documentation: A structure that contains the details for a partnership. A partnership represents the connection between you and your trading partner. It ties together a profile and one or more trading capabilities.

profileId.documentation: Returns the unique, system-generated identifier for the profile.

name.documentation: Returns the display name for profile.

businessName.documentation: Returns the name for the business associated with this profile.

logging.documentation: Specifies whether or not logging is enabled for this profile.

logGroupName.documentation: Returns the name of the logging group.

createdAt.documentation: Returns the timestamp for creation date and time of the profile.

modifiedAt.documentation: Returns the timestamp that identifies the most recent date and time that the profile was modified.

ProfileSummary.documentation: Contains the details for a profile. A profile is the mechanism used to create the concept of a private network.

ResourceNotFoundException.documentation: Occurs when the requested resource does not exist, or cannot be found. In some cases, the resource exists in a region other than the region specified in the API call.

bucketName.documentation: Specifies the name of the Amazon S3 bucket.

key.documentation: Specifies the Amazon S3 key for the file location.

S3Location.documentation: Specifies the details for the Amazon S3 file location that is being used with Amazon Web Services B2B Data Interchange. File locations in Amazon S3 are identified using a combination of the bucket and key.

input.documentation: An array of keys for your input sample documents.

output.documentation: An array of keys for your output sample documents.

SampleDocumentKeys.documentation: An array of the Amazon S3 keys used to identify the location for your sample documents.

bucketName.documentation: Contains the Amazon S3 bucket that is used to hold your sample documents.

keys.documentation: Contains an array of the Amazon S3 keys used to identify the location for your sample documents.

SampleDocuments.documentation: Describes a structure that contains the Amazon S3 bucket and an array of the corresponding keys used to identify the location for your sample documents.

resourceId.documentation: The ID for the resource that exceeded the quota, which caused the exception.

resourceType.documentation: The resource type (profile, partnership, transformer, or capability) that exceeded the quota, which caused the exception.

serviceCode.documentation: The code responsible for exceeding the quota, which caused the exception.

quotaCode.documentation: The quota that was exceeded, which caused the exception.

ServiceQuotaExceededException.documentation: Occurs when the calling command attempts to exceed one of the service quotas, for example trying to create a capability when you already have the maximum number of capabilities allowed.

inputFile.documentation: Specifies the location of the input file for the transformation. The location consists of an Amazon S3 bucket and prefix.

outputLocation.documentation: Specifies the location of the output file for the transformation. The location consists of an Amazon S3 bucket and prefix.

transformerId.documentation: Specifies the system-assigned unique identifier for the transformer.

transformerJobId.documentation: Returns the unique, system-generated identifier for a transformer run.

Key.documentation: Specifies the name assigned to the tag that you create.

Value.documentation: Contains one or more values that you assigned to the key name that you create.

Tag.documentation: Creates a key-value pair for a specific resource. Tags are metadata that you can use to search for and group a resource for various purposes. You can apply tags to capabilities, partnerships, profiles and transformers. A tag key can take more than one value. For example, to group capabilities for accounting purposes, you might create a tag called Group and assign the values Research and Accounting to that group.

ResourceARN.documentation: Specifies an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a specific Amazon Web Services resource, such as a capability, partnership, profile, or transformer.

Tags.documentation: Specifies the key-value pairs assigned to ARNs that you can use to group and search for resources by type. You can attach this metadata to resources (capabilities, partnerships, and so on) for any purpose.

TemplateDetails.documentation: A data structure that contains the information to use when generating a mapping template.

source.documentation: Specify the source file for an outbound EDI request.

target.documentation: Specify the format (X12 is the only currently supported format), and other details for the conversion target.

validationMessages.documentation: Returns an array of strings, each containing a message that Amazon Web Services B2B Data Interchange generates during the conversion.

inputFileContent.documentation: Specify the contents of the EDI (electronic data interchange) XML or JSON file that is used as input for the transform.

mappingTemplate.documentation:
Specifies the mapping template for the transformer. This template is used to map the parsed EDI file using JSONata or XSLT.

This parameter is available for backwards compatibility. Use the Mapping data type instead.

fileFormat.documentation: Specifies that the currently supported file formats for EDI transformations are JSON and XML.

mappedFileContent.documentation: Returns a string for the mapping that can be used to identify the mapping. Similar to a fingerprint

inputFile.documentation: Specifies an S3Location object, which contains the Amazon S3 bucket and prefix for the location of the input file.

fileFormat.documentation: Specifies that the currently supported file formats for EDI transformations are JSON and XML.

ediType.documentation: Specifies the details for the EDI standard that is being used for the transformer. Currently, only X12 is supported. X12 is a set of standards and corresponding messages that define specific business documents.

parsedFileContent.documentation: Returns the contents of the input file being tested, parsed according to the specified EDI (electronic data interchange) type.

retryAfterSeconds.documentation: The server attempts to retry a command that was throttled.

ThrottlingException.documentation: The request was denied due to throttling: the data speed and rendering may be limited depending on various parameters and conditions.

transformerId.documentation: Returns the system-assigned unique identifier for the transformer.

name.documentation: Returns the descriptive name for the transformer.

status.documentation: Returns the state of the newly created transformer. The transformer can be either active or inactive. For the transformer to be used in a capability, its status must active.

createdAt.documentation: Returns a timestamp indicating when the transformer was created. For example, 2023-07-20T19:58:44.624Z.

modifiedAt.documentation: Returns a timestamp representing the date and time for the most recent change for the transformer object.

fileFormat.documentation: Returns that the currently supported file formats for EDI transformations are JSON and XML.
fileFormat.deprecatedMessage: This is a legacy trait. Please use input-conversion or output-conversion.

mappingTemplate.documentation: Returns the mapping template for the transformer. This template is used to map the parsed EDI file using JSONata or XSLT.
mappingTemplate.deprecatedMessage: This is a legacy trait. Please use input-conversion or output-conversion.

ediType.documentation: Returns the details for the EDI standard that is being used for the transformer. Currently, only X12 is supported. X12 is a set of standards and corresponding messages that define specific business documents.
ediType.deprecatedMessage: This is a legacy trait. Please use input-conversion or output-conversion.

sampleDocument.documentation: Returns a sample EDI document that is used by a transformer as a guide for processing the EDI data.
sampleDocument.deprecatedMessage: This is a legacy trait. Please use input-conversion or output-conversion.

inputConversion.documentation: Returns a structure that contains the format options for the transformation.

mapping.documentation: Returns the structure that contains the mapping template and its language (either XSLT or JSONATA).

outputConversion.documentation: Returns the OutputConversion object, which contains the format options for the outbound transformation.

sampleDocuments.documentation: Returns a structure that contains the Amazon S3 bucket and an array of the corresponding keys used to identify the location for your sample documents.

TransformerSummary.documentation: Contains the details for a transformer object. A transformer can take an EDI file as input and transform it into a JSON-or XML-formatted document. Alternatively, a transformer can take a JSON-or XML-formatted document as input and transform it into an EDI file.

ResourceARN.documentation: Specifies an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a specific Amazon Web Services resource, such as a capability, partnership, profile, or transformer.

TagKeys.documentation: Specifies the key-value pairs assigned to ARNs that you can use to group and search for resources by type. You can attach this metadata to resources (capabilities, partnerships, and so on) for any purpose.

capabilityId.documentation: Specifies a system-assigned unique identifier for the capability.

name.documentation: Specifies a new name for the capability, to replace the existing name.

configuration.documentation: Specifies a structure that contains the details for a capability.

instructionsDocuments.documentation: Specifies one or more locations in Amazon S3, each specifying an EDI document that can be used with this capability. Each item contains the name of the bucket and the key, to identify the document's location.

capabilityId.documentation: Returns a system-assigned unique identifier for the capability.

capabilityArn.documentation: Returns an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a specific Amazon Web Services resource, such as a capability, partnership, profile, or transformer.

name.documentation: Returns the name of the capability, used to identify it.

type.documentation: Returns the type of the capability. Currently, only edi is supported.

configuration.documentation: Returns a structure that contains the details for a capability.

instructionsDocuments.documentation: Returns one or more locations in Amazon S3, each specifying an EDI document that can be used with this capability. Each item contains the name of the bucket and the key, to identify the document's location.

createdAt.documentation: Returns a timestamp for creation date and time of the capability.

modifiedAt.documentation: Returns a timestamp for last time the capability was modified.

partnershipId.documentation: Specifies the unique, system-generated identifier for a partnership.

name.documentation: The name of the partnership, used to identify it.

capabilities.documentation: List of the capabilities associated with this partnership.

capabilityOptions.documentation: To update, specify the structure that contains the details for the associated capabilities.

profileId.documentation: Returns the unique, system-generated identifier for the profile connected to this partnership.

partnershipId.documentation: Returns the unique, system-generated identifier for a partnership.

partnershipArn.documentation: Returns an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a specific Amazon Web Services resource, such as a capability, partnership, profile, or transformer.

name.documentation: The name of the partnership, used to identify it.

email.documentation: Returns the email address associated with this trading partner.

phone.documentation: Returns the phone number associated with the partnership.

capabilities.documentation: Returns one or more capabilities associated with this partnership.

capabilityOptions.documentation: Returns the structure that contains the details for the associated capabilities.

tradingPartnerId.documentation: Returns the unique, system-generated identifier for a trading partner.

createdAt.documentation: Returns a timestamp that identifies the most recent date and time that the partnership was modified.

modifiedAt.documentation: Returns a timestamp that identifies the most recent date and time that the partnership was modified.

profileId.documentation: Specifies the unique, system-generated identifier for the profile.

name.documentation: The name of the profile, used to identify it.

email.documentation: Specifies the email address associated with this customer profile.

phone.documentation: Specifies the phone number associated with the profile.

businessName.documentation: Specifies the name for the business associated with this profile.

profileId.documentation: Returns the unique, system-generated identifier for the profile.

profileArn.documentation: Returns an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the profile.

name.documentation: Returns the name of the profile.

email.documentation: Returns the email address associated with this customer profile.

phone.documentation: Returns the phone number associated with the profile.

businessName.documentation: Returns the name for the business associated with this profile.

logging.documentation: Specifies whether or not logging is enabled for this profile.

logGroupName.documentation: Returns the name of the logging group.

createdAt.documentation: Returns a timestamp for creation date and time of the profile.

modifiedAt.documentation: Returns a timestamp for last time the profile was modified.

transformerId.documentation: Specifies the system-assigned unique identifier for the transformer.

name.documentation: Specify a new name for the transformer, if you want to update it.

status.documentation: Specifies the transformer's status. You can update the state of the transformer, from active to inactive, or inactive to active.

fileFormat.documentation: Specifies that the currently supported file formats for EDI transformations are JSON and XML.
fileFormat.deprecatedMessage: This is a legacy trait. Please use input-conversion or output-conversion.

mappingTemplate.documentation:
Specifies the mapping template for the transformer. This template is used to map the parsed EDI file using JSONata or XSLT.

This parameter is available for backwards compatibility. Use the Mapping data type instead.

sampleDocument.documentation: Specifies a sample EDI document that is used by a transformer as a guide for processing the EDI data.

inputConversion.documentation: To update, specify the InputConversion object, which contains the format options for the inbound transformation.

mapping.documentation: Specify the structure that contains the mapping template and its language (either XSLT or JSONATA).

outputConversion.documentation: To update, specify the OutputConversion object, which contains the format options for the outbound transformation.

sampleDocuments.documentation: Specify a structure that contains the Amazon S3 bucket and an array of the corresponding keys used to identify the location for your sample documents.

transformerId.documentation: Returns the system-assigned unique identifier for the transformer.

transformerArn.documentation: Returns an Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for a specific Amazon Web Services resource, such as a capability, partnership, profile, or transformer.

name.documentation: Returns the name of the transformer.

status.documentation: Returns the state of the newly created transformer. The transformer can be either active or inactive. For the transformer to be used in a capability, its status must active.

createdAt.documentation: Returns a timestamp for creation date and time of the transformer.

modifiedAt.documentation: Returns a timestamp for last time the transformer was modified.

fileFormat.documentation: Returns that the currently supported file formats for EDI transformations are JSON and XML.
fileFormat.deprecatedMessage: This is a legacy trait. Please use input-conversion or output-conversion.

mappingTemplate.documentation: Returns the mapping template for the transformer. This template is used to map the parsed EDI file using JSONata or XSLT.

ediType.documentation: Returns the details for the EDI standard that is being used for the transformer. Currently, only X12 is supported. X12 is a set of standards and corresponding messages that define specific business documents.

sampleDocument.documentation: Returns a sample EDI document that is used by a transformer as a guide for processing the EDI data.
sampleDocument.deprecatedMessage: This is a legacy trait. Please use input-conversion or output-conversion.

inputConversion.documentation: Returns the InputConversion object, which contains the format options for the inbound transformation.

mapping.documentation: Returns the structure that contains the mapping template and its language (either XSLT or JSONATA).

outputConversion.documentation: Returns the OutputConversion object, which contains the format options for the outbound transformation.

sampleDocuments.documentation: Returns a structure that contains the Amazon S3 bucket and an array of the corresponding keys used to identify the location for your sample documents.

ValidationException.documentation: Occurs when a B2BI object cannot be validated against a request from another object.

componentSeparator.documentation: The component, or sub-element, separator. The default value is : (colon).

dataElementSeparator.documentation: The data element separator. The default value is * (asterisk).

segmentTerminator.documentation: The segment terminator. The default value is ~ (tilde).

X12Delimiters.documentation: In X12 EDI messages, delimiters are used to mark the end of segments or elements, and are defined in the interchange control header. The delimiters are part of the message's syntax and divide up its different elements.

transactionSet.documentation: Returns an enumerated type where each value identifies an X12 transaction set. Transaction sets are maintained by the X12 Accredited Standards Committee.

version.documentation: Returns the version to use for the specified X12 transaction set.

X12Details.documentation:
A structure that contains the X12 transaction set and version. The X12 structure is used when the system transforms an EDI (electronic data interchange) file.

If an EDI input file contains more than one transaction, each transaction must have the same transaction set and version, for example 214/4010. If not, the transformer cannot parse the file.

common.documentation: A container for the X12 outbound EDI headers.

X12Envelope.documentation:
A wrapper structure for an X12 definition object.

the X12 envelope ensures the integrity of the data and the efficiency of the information exchange. The X12 message structure has hierarchical levels. From highest to the lowest, they are:

  • Interchange Envelope

  • Functional Group

  • Transaction Set

applicationSenderCode.documentation: A value representing the code used to identify the party transmitting a message, at position GS-02.

applicationReceiverCode.documentation: A value representing the code used to identify the party receiving a message, at position GS-03.

responsibleAgencyCode.documentation: A code that identifies the issuer of the standard, at position GS-07.

X12FunctionalGroupHeaders.documentation: Part of the X12 message structure. These are the functional group headers for the X12 EDI object.

senderIdQualifier.documentation: Located at position ISA-05 in the header. Qualifier for the sender ID. Together, the ID and qualifier uniquely identify the sending trading partner.

senderId.documentation: Located at position ISA-06 in the header. This value (along with the senderIdQualifier) identifies the sender of the interchange.

receiverIdQualifier.documentation: Located at position ISA-07 in the header. Qualifier for the receiver ID. Together, the ID and qualifier uniquely identify the receiving trading partner.

receiverId.documentation: Located at position ISA-08 in the header. This value (along with the receiverIdQualifier) identifies the intended recipient of the interchange.

repetitionSeparator.documentation:
Located at position ISA-11 in the header. This string makes it easier when you need to group similar adjacent element values together without using extra segments.

This parameter is only honored for version greater than 401 (VERSION_4010 and higher).

For versions less than 401, this field is called StandardsId, in which case our service sets the value to U.

acknowledgmentRequestedCode.documentation: Located at position ISA-14 in the header. The value "1" indicates that the sender is requesting an interchange acknowledgment at receipt of the interchange. The value "0" is used otherwise.

usageIndicatorCode.documentation:
Located at position ISA-15 in the header. Specifies how this interchange is being used:

  • T indicates this interchange is for testing.

  • P indicates this interchange is for production.

  • I indicates this interchange is informational.

X12InterchangeControlHeaders.documentation: In X12, the Interchange Control Header is the first segment of an EDI document and is part of the Interchange Envelope. It contains information about the sender and receiver, the date and time of transmission, and the X12 version being used. It also includes delivery information, such as the sender and receiver IDs.

interchangeControlHeaders.documentation: In X12 EDI messages, delimiters are used to mark the end of segments or elements, and are defined in the interchange control header.

functionalGroupHeaders.documentation: The functional group headers for the X12 object.

delimiters.documentation: The delimiters, for example semicolon (;), that separates sections of the headers for the X12 object.

validateEdi.documentation: Specifies whether or not to validate the EDI for this X12 object: TRUE or FALSE.

X12OutboundEdiHeaders.documentation: A structure containing the details for an outbound EDI object.

documentation:
This is the Amazon Web Services B2B Data Interchange API Reference. It provides descriptions, API request parameters, and the XML response for each of the B2BI API actions.

B2BI enables automated exchange of EDI (electronic data interchange) based business-critical transactions at cloud scale, with elasticity and pay-as-you-go pricing. Businesses use EDI documents to exchange transactional data with trading partners, such as suppliers and end customers, using standardized formats such as X12.

Rather than actually running a command, you can use the --generate-cli-skeleton parameter with any API call to generate and display a parameter template. You can then use the generated template to customize and use as input on a later command. For details, see Generate and use a parameter skeleton file.
